intro: Epicranthes, commonly known as the marsh hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It is native to wetlands and marshy areas in tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plants typically have showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. They often feature heart-shaped leaves and are adapted to thrive in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Epicranthes species are sometimes cultivated for their ornamental value in gardens with suitable water conditions.
